About Me:
Biography

Dr. Mohan Kumar Gajendran is a postdoctoral fellow specializing in AI and Machine Learning at XYZ University. He completed his Ph.D. in Computer Science from ABC University, focusing on neural network optimization.

Interests

Dr. Gajendran has a keen interest in the fields of computational neuroscience and quantum computing. He is also passionate about teaching and mentoring young researchers.
Research:
Current Research

Currently focused on deep learning applications in biometrics, specifically in the area of facial recognition technology and its ethical implications.

Past Projects

Previously worked on developing algorithms for large-scale data analysis in genomic studies, contributing to significant breakthroughs in the field.
Publications:
Selected Publications

  • Gajendran, M.K., et al. (2022). Advances in Biometric Security: A Deep Learning Approach. Journal of AI Research.
  • Gajendran, M.K., et al. (2021). Exploring Quantum Computing for Big Data Processing. International Journal of Quantum Information.
Teaching:
Courses Taught

Dr. Gajendran has taught a variety of courses including Advanced Machine Learning, Introduction to AI, and Ethics in Computing.

Mentorship

He has mentored over 20 graduate students, guiding them through their thesis projects and research papers.
